intro: Brachypeza, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to dry environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Brachypeza is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
